data.title: Radioactive
data.solution:
isotope = input()
m = int(input())
h = int(input())

new_mass=m * (0.5)**h
time = 0
if isotope == "Plutonium-239":
    risk = new_mass * 575
    time = h * 24000
elif isotope == "Cesium-137":
    risk = new_mass * 4501
    time = h * 30.05
else:
    risk = new_mass * 5035.7
    time = h * 28.79

print(int(time), "years,", end=" ")
if risk >= 5:
    print("Deadly")
elif risk >= 1:
    print("Unsafe")
else:
    print("Safe")
data.statement:
High-level radioactive waste is a byproduct of Uranium fuel that has been used in a nuclear power reactor.

Half-life is a measure the time it takes half of the atoms to decay. Plutonium-239 for example  has a half-life of 24,000 years. This means that it will take 24,000 years for half of the current Plutonium-239 to decay and 48000 for three quarters to decay. 

Sieverts are a measure of the risk caused by the decay of a radioactive material. More than <<1 Sieverts (Sv)>> increases the likelihood of cancer and the fatal  dose for humans is  <<5 Sv>>.
Plutonium-239: 
    Sieverts per gram:  {{575}} Sv/g
    half-life: {{24000}} years
Cesium-137:
    Sieverts per gram: {{4501}} Sv/g
    half-life: {{30.05}} years 
Strontium-90:
    Sieverts per gram: {{5053.7}} Sv/g
    half-life: {{28.79}} years

Given the type ({{Plutonium-239}}, {{Cesium-137}}, or {{Strontium-90}}), the amount of radioactive waste disposed and the amount of half-lifes that have occured since burial, we want to estimate the amount of time (in years rounded down to  the nearest integer) that has passed and whether the risk is {{Safe}} <<(risk < 1 Sv)>>, {{Unsafe}} <<(1 Sv <= risk < 5 Sv)>> or {{Deadly}} <<(5 Sv <= risk)>> to enter the waste disposal location.
data.stubGenerator:
read isotope:string(13)
read m:int
read h:int

write Safe/Unsafe/Deadly
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> a string [[type]] as the type of nuclear waste disposed.
<<Line 2 :>> an integer [[m]] as the mass(in grams) of waste disposed.
<<Line 3 :>> an integer [[h]]  as the number of half-lives that have passed since disposal.
data.outputDescription: A single line containing the number of years [[t]]  that have passed since disposal (rounded down to the nearest integer) followed by {{Deadly}}, {{Unsafe}} or {{Safe}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

High-level radioactive waste is a byproduct of Uranium fuel that has been used in a nuclear power reactor.

Half-life is a measure the time it takes half of the atoms to decay. Plutonium-239 for example has a half-life of 24,000 years. This means that it will take 24,000 years for half of the current Plutonium-239 to decay and 48000 for three quarters to decay.

Sieverts are a measure of the risk caused by the decay of a radioactive material. More than 1 Sieverts (Sv) increases the likelihood of cancer and the fatal dose for humans is 5 Sv.
Plutonium-239:
Sieverts per gram: 575 Sv/g
half-life: 24000 years
Cesium-137:
Sieverts per gram: 4501 Sv/g
half-life: 30.05 years
Strontium-90:
Sieverts per gram: 5053.7 Sv/g
half-life: 28.79 years

Given the type (Plutonium-239, Cesium-137, or Strontium-90), the amount of radioactive waste disposed and the amount of half-lifes that have occured since burial, we want to estimate the amount of time (in years rounded down to the nearest integer) that has passed and whether the risk is Safe (risk < 1 Sv), Unsafe (1 Sv <= risk < 5 Sv) or Deadly (5 Sv <= risk) to enter the waste disposal location.
Input
Line 1 : a string type as the type of nuclear waste disposed.
Line 2 : an integer m as the mass(in grams) of waste disposed.
Line 3 : an integer h as the number of half-lives that have passed since disposal.
Output
A single line containing the number of years t that have passed since disposal (rounded down to the nearest integer) followed by Deadly, Unsafe or Safe
Constraints
0 <= m <= 10^6
0 <= h <= 10^9
Example
Input
Cesium-137
10
1
Output
30 years, Deadly
